snippet: Lizette Alvarez, a Times reporter, recalled her night in Florida City, Fla., in 1992 when Hurricane Andrew destroyed most of the motel she was staying in....
abstract: Reporter's Notebook; Lizette Alvarez describes her long history of weathering hurricanes while growing up in southern Florida, including particularly terrifying experience of surviving Hurricane Andrew in 1992; notes trepidation ahead of approaching Hurricane Matthew.
lead_paragraph: Lizette Alvarez, a Times reporter, recalled her night in Florida City, Fla., in 1992 when Hurricane Andrew destroyed most of the motel she was staying in.

headline.main: What It’s Like to Be Trapped by a Category 5 Hurricane
headline.print_headline: Surviving the Night in a Category 5 Storm
